page.title: 18Supernatural
page.content: At{Danesborough Fort}when the Danish invaders carried off the local women from villages nearby, all the menfolk stormed the fort to rescue them. The women took pity on a little Danish boy and hid him. His Ghost still walks through the fort today whistling. { Wordsworth,}according to local hearsay, wrote his poem, the "Danish Boy" after hearing this tale on one of his visits to Somerset. { Footsteps}have been heard upstairs in the Carew Arms. No hounds will enter Spinney House on Hurley Farm. { Superstitions}include, ill luck from some flowers, actions, colours, birds and animals. { Successful gardening}some believe is dependant upon the church calendar and phases of the moon.
